experience.description: Conducted an intensive research project focused on the application of Monte Carlo simulations to model the volatility of long-term disability claims. Utilized R and Python to analyze historical dataset patterns, identifying key correlations between economic indicators and claim frequency. Presented findings on risk mitigation strategies to a panel of academic and industry professionals.

Collaborated on a study examining the impact of changing mortality rates on pension fund solvency. Developed Generalized Linear Models (GLMs) to project future liabilities under various demographic scenarios. Cleaned and processed large-scale datasets to ensure the integrity of survival analysis calculations and life table development.

metadata.experience_level: Relevant research done for the job field.
